column1: 1 ^ Dòminus regnávit~; irascántur pòpuli. Qŭi sèdet super cherubíma~; moveátur terra. ^ The Lord hath reigned~; let the people be angry. He that sitteth on the cherubims~; let the earth be moved.

column2: et excèlsus super òmnes pòpulos. ^ The Lord is great in Sion
qŭóniam terrìbile et sanctum èst. ^ Let them give praise to thy great name
column3: for it is terrible and holy.

column1: 4 ^ Et honor regis judìcium díligit~; tu paravìsti directiónes~; judìcium et justìtiam in Jacóbe tu fecìsti. ^ And the king's honour loveth judgment~; thou hast prepared directions~; thou hast done judgment and justice in Jacob.

column3: qŭóniam sanctum èst. ^ Exalt ye the Lord our God

column1: 6 ^ Moses et Áharon in sacerdótibus ejus
column2: et Sámuel inter eos qŭi ìnvocant nomen ejus. Invocábant Dòminum
column3: et ìpse exaŭdiébat eos. ^ Moses and Aaron among his priests
column4: and Samuel among them that call upon his name. They called upon the Lord

column1: 7 ^ In colùmna nubis loqŭebátur ad eos~; custodiébant testimónia ejus
column2: et praĕcèptum qŭod dèdit illîs. ^ He spoke to them in the pillar of the cloud. They kept his testimonies
column3: and the commandment which he gave them.

column2: tu exaŭdiébas eos~; Deus tu propìtius fuìsti eîs
column3: et ulcíscens in òmnes adinventiónes eórum. ^ O Lord our God
column4: thou didst hear them~; thou wast a merciful God to them
column5: and taking vengeance on all their inventions.

column2: et adoráte in mònte sancto ejus
column3: qŭóniam sanctus Dòminus Deus noster. ^ Exalt ye the Lord our God
column4: and adore at his holy mountain
column5: for the Lord our God is holy.
